metadata.description: Complete health, fitness, and transition tracking data

logging_conventions.timezone: Pacific Time (PT) - UTC-8/UTC-7. User is located in Seattle, Washington, US.
logging_conventions.late_night_entries: When logging late at night or in early morning hours (after midnight), assume entries are for the previous calendar day unless explicitly stated otherwise. If it's 2AM Tuesday, treat food/activity logs as Monday's data by default.

chocolate.notes: Assume this brand/type unless otherwise specified

chili.recipe_notes: Uses 4 Tbsp olive oil and adds 2 dates

smoothie.notes: This is the default smoothie unless stated otherwise

oatmeal.notes: This is the default breakfast unless stated otherwise

soy_milk.notes: Always refers to Silk unsweetened unless otherwise specified

protein.philosophy: On estrogen with suppressed testosterone, protein alone doesn't cause muscle retention - training stimulus does. Focus on distribution quality (diffuse, fat-paired) rather than minimizing total grams.
key_factors: Distribution: spread across meals rather than concentrated
Pairing: consumed with fats and carbs, not lean/isolated
Timing: avoid acute protein immediately post-workout
Context: combined with no upper-body training stimulus

calories.philosophy: Consistent moderate surplus signals metabolic safety and provides substrate for estrogen-driven fat redistribution. Avoid volatile swings between deficit and large surplus.

carbs.philosophy: Neutral or positive. Primary fuel for endurance and lower-body training. No distinction between complex and simple.

fat.philosophy: Supportive. Essential for hormone production, fat-soluble vitamins, and calorie intake without protein.

evaluation_criteria.green: Calories 2600-2900, protein 100-120g when diffuse/fat-paired, calm and permissive
evaluation_criteria.yellow: Inconsistent calories (swings above 3200+ or below 2400), or convenience-dominated but adequate energy
evaluation_criteria.red: Calorie restriction pattern, or acute/lean protein that could signal retention if repeated

fitness_philosophy.big_picture: Long-term trans feminization with health, stability, and sustainability. Optimize for selective change over time: let estrogen work while avoiding stressors that cause rebound, stagnation, or injury.
physique_goals: Allow upper-body muscle to gradually atrophy without provoking defensive retention
Support estrogen-driven fat redistribution (hips, thighs, chest)
Maintain or subtly enhance glutes and hips for shape and proportion
Move through time + consistency, not force
Prioritize softness, drape, posture over metrics

cardio.approach: Regular aerobic work (running, cycling, elliptical, walking) for cardiovascular health, recovery, and fat-friendly stress
cardio.intensity: Managed to avoid injury and excessive cortisol

strength.lower_body: Two medium-high intensity glute sessions per week for maintenance and slow hypertrophy. Both sessions target glutes with controlled effort, avoiding failure. Optional third session if recovery permits.

mobility.approach: End-range loading (ATG split squats, loaded stretches) for tissue health. Addresses hip irritation noted in ballet.

other.ballet: Movement quality and nervous-system regulation, not training stress
other.climbing: Social and occasional, not a conditioning driver

health_priorities: Heart health: endurance exercise, fiber, omega-3s, stress reduction
Joint health: mobility, varied movement, avoiding excessive load
Mental health: routine, non-punitive rules, not tying self-worth to metrics
Hormonal environment: adequate energy, dietary fat, avoiding chronic stress
